author: jsign
content:
[sidenote: I think you stopped refering to point serialization, right? sqrt of finite field elements isn't needed for that, but for point deserialization. mentioning just in case]

The story on how we have a fast sqrt for go-ipa mainly summaries as I getting in a rabbit hole, reverse engineering some really clever idea that Gottfried did in another repo after some Twitter discussion (funny...)
Back in march when this happened, I knew this was going to be too important for other cryptography libs to consider for VKTs, so I wrote an article explaining how all this works: https://ihagopian.com/posts/tonelli-shanks-with-precomputed-dlog-tables (the intro has the Twitter story...)

So I wrote that for some reasons: 1) It could be useful for other people in the future (like you today), 2) For "future me" if I want to go back to remembering all this ðŸ˜…  3) Hopefully nobody had to reverse engineer how this works by reading code again.
